verses.verse: A Prayer <S%H8605><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. Hear <S%H8085><s%> the right <S%H6664><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, attend <S%H7181><s%> unto my cry <S%H7440><s%>, give ear <S%H238><s%> unto my prayer <S%H8605><s%>, that goeth not <S%H3808><s%> out of feigned <S%H4820><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%>. the right: Heb. justice not: Heb. without lips of deceit
Let my sentence <S%H4941><s%> come forth <S%H3318><s%> from thy presence <S%H6440><s%>; let thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> behold <S%H2372><s%> the things that are equal <S%H4339><s%>.

Thou hast proved <S%H974><s%> mine heart <S%H3820><s%>; thou hast visited <S%H6485><s%> me in the night <S%H3915><s%>; thou hast tried <S%H6884><s%> me, and shalt find <S%H4672><s%> nothing; I am purposed <S%H2161><s%> that my mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall not transgress <S%H5674><s%>.
Concerning the works <S%H6468><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>, by the word <S%H1697><s%> of thy lips <S%H8193><s%> I have kept <S%H8104><s%> me from the paths <S%H734><s%> of the destroyer <S%H6530><s%>.
Hold up <S%H8551><s%> my goings <S%H838><s%> in thy paths <S%H4570><s%>, that my footsteps <S%H6471><s%> slip <S%H4131><s%> not. slip: Heb. be not moved
I have called <S%H7121><s%> upon thee, for thou wilt hear <S%H6030><s%> me, O God <S%H410><s%>: incline <S%H5186><s%> thine ear <S%H241><s%> unto me, and hear <S%H8085><s%> my speech <S%H565><s%>.

Shew thy marvellous <S%H6395><s%> lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, O thou that savest <S%H3467><s%> by thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> them which put their trust <S%H2620><s%> in thee from those that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against them. by thy: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand
Keep <S%H8104><s%> me as the apple <S%H380><s%> of the eye <S%H1323><s%> <S%H5869><s%>, hide <S%H5641><s%> me under the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of thy wings <S%H3671><s%>,

From <S%H6440><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> that <S%H2098><s%> oppress <S%H7703><s%> me, from my deadly <S%H5315><s%> enemies <S%H341><s%>, who compass me about <S%H5362><s%>. oppress: Heb. waste my: Heb. my enemies against the soul
They are inclosed <S%H5462><s%> in their own fat <S%H2459><s%>: with their mouth <S%H6310><s%> they speak <S%H1696><s%> proudly <S%H1348><s%>.
They have now compassed <S%H5437><s%> us in our steps <S%H838><s%>: they have set <S%H7896><s%> their eyes <S%H5869><s%> bowing down <S%H5186><s%> to the earth <S%H776><s%>;

Like <S%H1825><s%> as a lion <S%H738><s%> that is greedy <S%H3700><s%> of his prey <S%H2963><s%>, and as it were a young lion <S%H3715><s%> lurking <S%H3427><s%> in secret places <S%H4565><s%>. Like: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin lurking: Heb. sitting

Arise <S%H6965><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, disappoint <S%H6923><s%> him <S%H6440><s%>, cast him down <S%H3766><s%>: deliver <S%H6403><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, which is thy sword <S%H2719><s%>: disappoint: Heb. prevent his face which is: or, by

From men <S%H4962><s%> which are thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, from men <S%H4962><s%> of the world <S%H2465><s%>, which have their portion <S%H2506><s%> in this life <S%H2416><s%>, and whose belly <S%H990><s%> thou fillest <S%H4390><s%> with thy hid <S%H6840><s%> treasure: they are full <S%H7646><s%> of children <S%H1121><s%>, and leave <S%H3240><s%> the rest <S%H3499><s%> of their substance to their babes <S%H5768><s%>. which are: or, by they: or, their children are full
As for me, I will behold <S%H2372><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> in righteousness <S%H6664><s%>: I shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%>, when I awake <S%H6974><s%>, with thy likeness <S%H8544><s%>.
